cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles SW of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn northwest today and then north on Saturday, tracking toward the central Louisiana coast and then up the Mississippi Valley.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near Intracoastal City–Morgan City)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Grand Isle, LA and Intracoastal City to Cameron, LA.  Tropical Storm Watch: east of the Mouth of the Pearl River to the MS/AL border.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Intracoastal City to Grand Isle, LA.  Tropical Storm Warning: Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle, LA; Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas; Intracoastal City to Cameron, LA.  Storm-Surge Warning: Intracoastal City, LA to Biloxi, MS including Lake Pontchartrain.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward to coastal Mississippi/Alabama with greatest impacts over south-central Louisiana.
weather_observation.wind: Breezy northeasterly winds possible, occasional gusts 20–30 mph; tropical-storm-force winds unlikely (≤4% probability).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 0.5–1.5 ft possible due to distant on-shore flow, not expected to exceed 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light to locally moderate rain bands; 1–3 inches possible, well below 4-inch threshold.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough Gulf seas could briefly interrupt small-craft operations; otherwise no significant hazards forecast for Calhoun Port Authority, TX.
